abstract: Handel and Haydn Society is celebrating its 200th birthday in 2015 with series of performances in Boston; society, which claims to be oldest continuously performing arts organization in United States, evolved from amateur oratorio club into one of country's most prominent ensembles.
lead_paragraph: The Boston oratorio group’s performances began with an 1815 partial rendition of “The Creation” and included the American premiere of Verdi’s Requiem in 1878.

headline.main: Handel and Haydn Society Celebrates 200 Years
headline.print_headline: A New-Music Group Older Than Most

snippet: The Boston oratorio group’s performances began with an 1815 partial rendition of “The Creation” and included the American premiere of Verdi’s Requiem in 1878.
